website_summaries.verdict: The premium vegan protein blend meant for people wanting the most nutrients in their dishes.
pros: Formula is free of common harmful additives such as genetically modified organisms, gluten, and soy
Comes in chocolate, vanilla, and unflavored varieties to match your personal tastes
cons: Strong additional flavors required to hide the pea taste

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, they do not stand by their products. I used their product for a year and had no problems. My last purchase of Pea Protein would not mix even in a $400 blender. It was like drinking wet sand. I contacted the company and expected to get a replacement. They told me once you pay for it you are stuck with whatever they send you no matter how poor the product. Not someone I will be doing business with any more
customer_reviews.author: Jim Eugenis

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Taste
customer_reviews.text: My first jar of the unflavored pea protein tasted just fine. I would put 2 scoops in my smoothie and couldn't even taste the powder. The second jar I got tastes horrible! I can hardly manage 1/2 a scoop in my smoothie because it makes it taste so bad. From other reviews, it looks like this is a common problem with Naked products, so I won't be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Even if it made me a Sayan, it’s taste HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I’m very good concience , it’s ingrained not to waste or throw away food. In 23yrs of supplemnting (on & off), this is the FIRST & ONLY product I could Not finish no matter how hard I tried. It’s sandy & horrible tasting. I can remain Vegan without having to subject my self to this. The balance went to the garbage, as much as it pains me to discard Food.
customer_reviews.author: Lenin

customer_reviews.title: Legitimacy
customer_reviews.text: When you go to call them, they refuse to tell you where the protein is processed. This gives you every right not to trust this company. If they are not confident with what is inside of their products what makes this company think that we are confident in them. I called numerous times and was told basically to screw off we can't tell you that information. A BIG THUMBS DOWN TO ANYONE WHO CARES ABOUT THEIR HEALTH AND HEAVY METAL CONTAMINATION.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Moreland

customer_reviews.title: Dairy-free protein powder of my dreams
customer_reviews.text: The cleanest protein that I know! There’s no dairy, no fillers, and only one ingredient. For those that say this tastes gross...let me tell you. You’re doing it wrong! Compared to most protein powders this one thickens quickly with water. You’ve got to think of it like hummus! I don’t drink this protein powder - I add enough water to keep it thick and I eat it with a spoon (and sometimes just like a veggie dip). Stop complaining about the taste and start appreciating it for how great it is to have such a clean protein powder. You’re welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I tried the sample. Then bought the 5LB tub. Two completely different products. The sample was great. The tub was an inedible uber salty mess like a few other reported. Returned it and contacted the company. After all I did like the sample and the product was promising. To their credit they contacted back to ask for the order number. But that was it. Never heard back from them. Basically they have poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Yurzola

customer_reviews.title: unknown unground pieces
customer_reviews.text: I found many pieces that according to the seller were "unground peas" but after trying them I developed an allergic reaction. By they responses, they confirmed that quality is not always something they are aiming to have in their products. I would advise you to buy another product with higher standards that will not compromise your health with unwanted allergies.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Borras

customer_reviews.title: Decent product. Taste is a little hard to handle ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent product. Taste is a little hard to handle but if you give a protein product a lower score for that your a moron. Reason I lowered score was the company suggests is manufactured in the USA but it’s actually Asia. Their customer service told me their product was a by-product of noodle production and Asia has a much higher demand. Product is extracted using water and tested before it’s sold. Not a fan of China or Asia products.
customer_reviews.author: Rating this stuff yo!

customer_reviews.title: Worst tasting protein ive ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I have been lifting weights for over 10 years and have had nearly every protein powder on the market. I have had some nasty ones, but this one is by far the grossest tasting protein powder I've had to date. The first time I drank it, I mixed it with soy milk and shook for 30 seconds as the label states. I nearly puked after one sip. Then I laughed at it being labeled unflavored. I guess chalk and mud isn't consider a flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: This tasted so bad, even with the addition of vanilla extract and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the unflavored, five pound size. I use protein powder every day. This tasted so bad, even with the addition of vanilla extract and fruit, that I threw away the huge container.
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: 75% full opened box received that was resealed above lid alone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and when it arrived, the box only looked at about 70-75% full. However, since it had the plastic seal on top, I ignored it thinking maybe that was the weight anyways. When I removed the plastic seal on the lid and opened the lid, I noticed the firm seal underneath was already half open indicating someone used it, used some of the contents and then resealed the top alone. Very disappointed given how excited I was to try this new protein powder. Won't be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Venkat Raman

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt tast good
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't taste good. I sure the product is great for other things like cooking but if you plan on mixing it with water think again.im mixing it with other flavored powder so it's not going to wast. When it's gone I'm going to try the less naked kind.
customer_reviews.author: whitney moore

customer_reviews.title: Wet Sand
customer_reviews.text: Less Naked Pea tastes awful. It is bitter & chalky and must be blended with a smoothie or fruit to mask the gluey drywall flavor. On top of this, it does not dissolve in liquid well. The mouth and throat feel of the beverage is like drinking wet sand. If you want to exfoliate your esophagus, you’ve come to the right place. The only positive thing I can think of is that it is 3 wholesome ingredients. But, it’s so bad that I’m considering going back to animal based protein powder products.
customer_reviews.author: 15083san

customer_reviews.title: ?? Feet smell
customer_reviews.text: OK I don't have crazy expectations of it having great flavor but seriously it smells like.. sweaty feet. The first time I had it I thought ok my bad... I should have realistic expectations and consider that this has no flavoring etc... So this second time I added flavoring.. it was better but seriously it didnt cover the smell .. like .. feet... not strong but enough to make it taste bad... I am going to try a 3rd batch and add more flavoring to mask it... maybe... if it is better I will update my review
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Interesting experience
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this protein blend made me feel sick; it may be the high concentration of yellow peas. When I reached out to the Naked Nutrition, I got the runaround, no responses from them, and finally when they did respond, they were rude, not answering my actual question, and seemed unprofessional. It was weird. I don't recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: K.G.

customer_reviews.title: Half empty jar
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my husband who is newly a vegan and was very disappointed to see that the jar is half full! No protein o have ever purchased has had such a low amount in the jar. I am very dissatisfied and we haven't even opened the product. It's a shame it cant be returned either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Pea Protein, But Far Inferior To Now Discontinued Matcha Blend
customer_reviews.text: I like Naked brand, and their pea protein is definitely premium. However, the company's more superior product, Naked Pea + Matcha, was a homerun and I'm left forever disappointed by the plain pea protein -- especially, since it's at a similar price point, but minus the super antioxidant of matcha. I tried Naked Whey Protein + Matcha, but it caused GI upset for me. I already informed Naked they should bring back the vegan protein blend, but companies rarely listen to consumers anymore. Even a quality brand like Naked only cares about maximizing profits vs satisfying the demand of brand loyal customers.
customer_reviews.author: amj

customer_reviews.title: Will not purchase this product again
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this product I talked to a sales rep because they were out of the Naked Rice. He assured me that you would not taste the powder in chocolate almond milk or any other flavored beverages. This product has a very strong taste and does not mix well in flavored beverages. You will taste the powder no matter what you mix in. It made me sick and I am unable to use this product. If you discover you do not like this product the company will not do anything to make it right. You will be out the 55 dollars and will be stuck with a 5lb container that you are unable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wanted to love it since I try to eat mainly vegan
customer_reviews.text: wanted to love it since I try to eat mainly vegan. It's good in theory but the taste is absolutely intolerable. And I've been known to drink eggs pre vegan days like rocky without a problem
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tyler J Mazzoncini

customer_reviews.title: It is terrible tasting but I didn't buy it for the taste
customer_reviews.text: It is terrible tasting but I didn't buy it for the taste. I bought it for the simple processing and protein content. Otherwise I consume it daily and use a banana and some honey in my smoothie to cover the taste. Cilantro also helps when I have it.
customer_reviews.author: coach9484

customer_reviews.title: Awful taste too much to overcome
customer_reviews.text: I pretty much never write reviews but have to with this to warn others. The taste of this protein powder is extremely awful. I know that a plain pea protein powder is not going to taste great but it shouldn't be disgusting - I actually almost threw up this morning (and I usually can tolerate this kind of stuff). This flavor/taste also is very difficult to mask. I now feel like I wasted $50+ bucks because I don't think I'll be able to stomach any more of this. So, save yourself some trouble and skip this powder.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: For the health conscious
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand why people are complaining about a NON FLAVORED pea protein. First off, it’s NON FLAVORED PEOPLE. Add your own ingredients to give it taste. This protein is made for people who value ingredients over taste. The only ingredient is Pea Protein. That’s it. Nothing else. Zip. Zilch. Nada. I add an entire banana, 2-3 spoonful of natural peanut butter (with No added sugar) and raw honey for sweetness. It’s absolutely delicious. Only protein I will eat.
customer_reviews.author: Jason & Magaly Alicea

customer_reviews.title: Metallic after taste.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this brand, but somehow this product has a strong chemical or metal aftertaste that was hard to get out. Second time I used it was worse than the first, so I stoped using it. It was not a pea taste! UPDATE: After contacting the seller, they blew me off about the metallic taste and sent me a link to Amazon return policy stating I could not return the product. Terrible customer service and so I will not be ordering from this company any more.
customer_reviews.author: Ehuanochtli

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. The taste is very plain, but the texture is smooth. If you can't handle drinking something that isn't sweet, you can mix it with something. I usually just gut it and have a gulp of water afterward. Sometimes when I'm in the mood to just sit and sip on it, I will mix it with a chocolate syrup a teaspoon of sugar. Pop it in a blender with an overripe banana and 100% peanut peanut butter to really up your naked game. Goes well with flax, almond, rice, and soy milk, but in a pinch water will do.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Mustain

customer_reviews.title: Contamination- horribly sick
customer_reviews.text: I firmly believe this product was contaminated somehow. I have used it twice and have gotten horribly ill after, I was doubled over on the toilet, vomiting, my gut felt extremely painful with deep cramping etc. The feeling would subside after 5 or so hours. I had purchased one prior and it was fine. Why the inconsistency in this product?! Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Clean Protein | Nasty Taste
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to digest! Being lactose intolerant, this was definitely a great change of protein. I love being able to take my double servings without soiling my pants. IF YOU ARE TASTE CONSCIOUS, BUY THE CHOCOLATE FLAVOR. This is by far one the most disgusting things I've ever tasted.
customer_reviews.author: A.Wat45

customer_reviews.title: Best Pea Protein Isolate for the money
customer_reviews.text: I searched and searched for Pea Protein Isolate that was a value price but also didn't have any added sugars or other ingredients and had the most protein per serving. So far this has been the best I've found. I can't be vegetarian because my body really hates me when I don't eat some animal proteins daily. But I still try to eat a minimal as possible, so adding pea protein into my smoothies or cooking with it, really helps keep my protein intake up while not having to eat too much animal protein. I've found it's a good balance and has been helping me lose weight and lower my blood pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie J

customer_reviews.title: Warning - Inconsistent/Misleading Labeling of Amino Acid Ratio Breakdowns
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this protein specifically because the images for the product showed that it had lower amounts of arginine than lysine. The protein I received has higher amounts of arginine than lysine. I feel that this product is falsely advertised and want a refund. The attached picture shows the arginine amount shown in the product info. The product I received contained 2382 mg.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Rood

customer_reviews.title: It's protein...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is heinous. There is no reality where you drink it for pleasure. I even bought the vanilla to help with flavor based on the reviews. Put it in a smoothie or 8oz milk + 2tbsp peanut butter, whatever it takes to get it down. It is thick, gritty and turns into glue. It sticks to your blender, glass and leaves your throat feeling mucousy... But it's concentrated protein so if your goal is to add a significant protein boost to your diet without additives, complex ingredients or sweeteners, this does the trick. I'm not sure I'll buy it again... After 5lbs I imagine I'm going to be pretty sick of it, but we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: It’s honestly not the greatest mixed into smoothies
customer_reviews.text: It’s honestly not the greatest mixed into smoothies, but I’m the type of person who can easily get over that & chug a protein drink anyway...plus, what do you expect with something that has no added sugars of other stuff? (I also have 5 kids ages 8 & under...I’m not picky on being able to eat. I’m just thankful for the opportunity!). But I DO love mixing this into breads & pancakes to make them more hearty & filling for the kids!! And they don’t even notice!! I’ll order it again just because it comes in bulk & we need grocery items like that!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I like the size (amount). I like that it's pure vegan protein. Many other vegan protein powders are mixed with other things. This is not. With that being said, the flavor is bad (Vanilla). I do mix it with my green drink and sometimes acai or blend with fruit, which makes it fine. I can not drink it straight. Despite that, I would buy this product again. It is totally worth the price, given the amount, and pureness.
customer_reviews.author: pmc

customer_reviews.title: This has been my life line for the last 4-5 years.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for two reasons: 1. Body muscle building and strength, and 2. s/p Gastric cancer and most of my stomach with pylorus and early duodenum removed with potential protein and nutritional deficiency issues. With my background an as RN and decades of keeping healthy thru nutrition and exercise at the forefront already and, after an interval with stomach CA and surgery, I found this powder to be literally a "God-send'! I blend home juices from local fruits together with 3 scoops of this powder. Because of it, I have had no protein deficiency symptoms such as hair loss, alopcia, or muscle loss. - This made in the USA product is quality and it's safe and healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Perla Wilde, III

customer_reviews.title: Clean protein, but poor texture and taste
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate that they’ve stripped away any unnecessary ingredients and kept this product very clean. Unfortunately I’m giving it a 2 star rating because this was extremely difficult for me to drink. I just could not handle the taste and texture. Compared to some of the whey proteins I’ve been accustomed to drinking, this was chalky and extremely grassy tasting. More grassy than my greens powder that I take on a regular basis. If you have an aversion to some tastes and textures, I’d recommend finding something else. And this powder is so staticky, every time I drop a scoop in my shaker powder sprays all over my countertops.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Younkman

customer_reviews.title: The taste is hard to ignore
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible tasting. I know the notion of "terrible tasting" is extremely subjective but after having this for a few weeks, I find that blending this with peanut butter or banana are just about the only things that can fight the taste of this. Essentially you are adding chalk to your smoothie. It will overtake the flavor and consistency of most smoothies you make. I can't speak of the ingredient quality, because honestly who can truly attest to that. But I'll take their word for it. Sorry for this honest review but I hope you
customer_reviews.author: Robert V.

customer_reviews.title: Great product I just wish the packaging was more conservative
customer_reviews.text: This powder is silky smooth to the touch, like no powder I’ve ever felt. The taste and amount of protein in one serving is just was I was hoping/ looking for. Two things that I noticed is that the powder was a little staticky when I was transferring it over to my glassware storage. The one thing that I really did not like is the amount of plastic used. I am really conscious of trying/ attempting to make my footprint as minimal as I can, and with the exceptions of 2 servings (2 scoops) the rest of the product fit in this 32 ounce mason jar.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Allen

customer_reviews.title: Takes some getting use to
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the taste at 1st...its horrible with just water. I use a fruit (banana or mixed berried) and its very good with the fruit. With just the almond milk its very blaaahhh. so after this container was done I ordered another non dairy shake. Well let's just say I'm back to ordering Naked Pea. I like the light taste however its a bit chalky. It is aslo very easy on my stomach. I will continue to purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second tub I buy of the vanilla pea protein by less naked pea. I loved the first one but this second one tastes awful. It tastes nothing like the first tub I bought. There is almost no vanilla flavor to it. I thought maybe I got an expired tub but according to the box it is not expired. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Very mild flavor, mixes well, stomach feels good
customer_reviews.text: This is the most inoffensive protein powder I've ever tried. It mixes so easily in a shaker bottle. The flavor is very mild and natural tasting, similar to nut milk or grain milk. It does not upset my stomach at all. If you're looking for a delightful flavor experience, forget it. In fact, don't even bother taking ANY protein powder...But, if you have reasonable expectations and understand you are drinking UNFLAVORED PEA POWDER, you will probably be satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: GradiusGhost

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your $$$
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. Unfortunately, it was extremely gritty and did not blend well. When I contacted the company to ask about this, they had no explanation. ALSO - after doing a ton of research on protein powders and trying to find the most absorbable formulas, I found that this product doesn't fit any of the important criteria. The amino acid profile is not good and the absorbability is not good which means that what you're ingesting is not getting metabolized so that your body can use it. If you want a vegan protein powder, I recommend buying one that is fermented so that it doesn't cause bloating and is more absorbable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Wahab

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell Hard to get past
customer_reviews.text: This is the second container I have ordered and this container once mixed develops a horse manure smell making it difficult to drink. I even tried the Whey and same thing happened. I returned both containers. Disappointed bc the first shipment tasted and smelled good
customer_reviews.author: A. Naleppa

customer_reviews.title: Try it in smaller pack.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful, this protein powder might not go with your system. It makes me uneasy and bloated. I tried giving it away for free to my friends but they had the same issue to. If you are like me who’s buying it based on the reviews, make sure to buy it in a smaller pack as possible. The unflavored taste like chickpea flour in taste and texture.
customer_reviews.author: MeGu3007

customer_reviews.title: It tastes how you would expect, but that's what I like about it
customer_reviews.text: I love this protein because the ingredients. No added flavors, unnecessary fillers, heavy metals, etc. It is exactly what I want and expect; if you want protein it gives you protein. I do admit it doesn't taste the best (although to me it is definitely drinkable because I enjoy earth drinks like green juices, wheatgrass, etc.), but I always mix it into a smoothie and I can barely notice a difference. I don't understand how people can expect this stuff to be the best tasting thing out there when it legit just has peas. Anyways, if you want a no bs protein then this is for you. Lasted about 4 months with pretty consistent use.
customer_reviews.author: Darin French

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is pretty good! I weigh it out to 25g of protein and add 4g of matcha powder with one packet of sucralose and 12oz of water. For an idea of flavor...it tastes like the dried peas that come in some trail mixes. Very minimal but definitely distinct and noticeable. It also doesn’t blend with water super well, but I suspect that’s because it’s a pure version of a plant based protein. I didn’t really notice the subtle grittiness after drinking it a couple times. Overall, it’s a win from me.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Zormeier

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected, but didn't get the 15 servings as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It really isn't that bad. I mix this with 12 ounces of water and 2 tsp of beet root powder and give the whole thing a shake in a blender cup for about 30 seconds. No lumps or anything odd using that method. It's weird seeing people complain about the container being half empty. It's advertised as 15 servings (2 scoops per serving), but I only got 13.5 servings out of the container. I didn't even pack down the scoop, just leveled it off. Probably won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: TheTrailGeek

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best protein powder on the market PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: Just look at the ingredients and the nutritional info. Ingredients: non-GMO & Vegan yellow pea protein That's it! Nutritional info per serving: Protein - 27g Calories - 120 Fat - 0.5g Carbs - 2g Sodium - 110mg Absolutely NOTHING compares! PLUS: - great amino acid profile - good results on the heavy metals screening - protein to dollar ratio is amazing, about 37g protein per $1 cost
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Nasty taste
customer_reviews.text: This was gross. It's supposed to be unflavored, but it has a nasty taste. I tried mixing it with oatmeal, brown sugar, almonds and craisins. I couldn't even eat it. I am not a body builder used to eating powdered anything. I'm an average person who doesn't like foods that contain protein, so I'm trying to find an alternative. This wasn't it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Do not like the taste at all
customer_reviews.text: If it were based on taste alone, I couldn't give this product any stars! We add protein powder to an otherwise delicious fruit smoothie. This protein powder completely negates the taste of the fruit and leaves you with a blah drink. It's not exactly awful, but it sure isn't good. If it weren't a quality product and providing protein, I would not drink it at all. This is a large container and I can't just throw it out, but I do look forward to the day it's all gone.
customer_reviews.author: Tweevie

customer_reviews.title: Quality protein at the perfect price point
customer_reviews.text: This is our go-to vegan protein that has the perfect balance of quality and budget. It’s flavor falls a little short but it’s not packed with sugar, which is one of the reasons we like it so much. In terms of flavor head-to-head, it’s not going to compete with ON Gold Standard vanilla milkshake because, well, it’s not trying to. Part of the Naked Nutrition brand is transparency. This stuff is wholesome and their amino acid profile posted on the back says VOLUMES about their ingredient quality. I make a pretty loaded shake with blueberries, spinach, half a banana, some ice, powdered peanut butter, and two scoops of Naked Pea pretty much twice a day and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Springer

customer_reviews.title: Natural and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff! Natural and no additional crap. I've been using other brands that all contained sucralose or other garbage for many years and while some may have tasted slightly better, I've been quite impressed with this brand tasting pretty decent mixed with milk (or whatever) and feeling much better without the additives that seemed to give me occasional headaches or digestive discomfort. I never thought I was so sensitive to some of the additives until I changed my supplements and cut back on certain liquid or food products that contained those additives and I've been feeling so much better on a daily note!
customer_reviews.author: Xander Danger

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff, it's a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pea protein! I use three scopes in a frozen fruit (strawberries, blueberries, etc.) smoothie with fresh kale, broccoli sprouts, unsweetened almond mild, vanilla extract, ground flax, erythritol, and a bit of fresh carrot every day for breakfast at about 9AM. I don't get hungry again until 2PM! I feel better and I'm loosing weight as I work out. Great product, so don't listen to the sour grape poor ratings on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Tastes so bad. Rude customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Very bad taste, even in a strawberry banana smoothie. Makes the drink gritty like sand. I like the quality of the product, but the taste is absolutely awful Andy had to gag down the few drinks I make before returning. If you can stand the taste I am sure it’s an ok protein product. Customer service was very rude and condescending, the main reason for the 1 Star. Childish responses. Not a fan of the company.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It comes down to quality... 2 scoops = 27g
customer_reviews.text: Most other pea proteins Ive bought in 5-7lb containers use 1 scoop = ~22-24g protein. This does make a difference in your blending/thickness. You can read hundreds of reviews and analysis of ingredient quality and studies, this stuff tastes like all the others Ive tried (good), but it is pricey and it does take TWO SCOOPS to get 27g protein. This stuff is supposedly grown organic in the US & Canada whereas most others grown in China (via Amazon answers). But how much does that matter anymore? In America its legal to use use fracking water to irrigate crops. Organic doesn't mean what people think it does.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this protein powder!
customer_reviews.text: Love this protein powder! The taste isn’t the greatest, but I’m happy to make the compromise because the ingredient are what I want in my protein powder. I just flavor it by using fruit. It blends really well! I did stop using this kind though, as I am trying to conceive and read that peas miiiight have some slight contraceptive qualities... so I’m using the egg and the peanut butter protein now, which are both equally great! So happy to have this product, with no stevia and 20 other ingredients in it!
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Pea soup with a hint of mothballs!  NO returns!!
customer_reviews.text: Mixes well, but tastes awful. I made two smoothies with it. One strawberry banana, one with blueberries. It needed a lot of sweetener to make it drinkable. It has a pea soup taste, like lentils and a old timey medicine taste, like moth balls or something. Not something you want to drink. There are NO returns on this so buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: FW

customer_reviews.title: I Will Keep Buying
customer_reviews.text: I had been using another brand of pea protein for many years. That brand has a ton of ingredients where this has three. I like that there is less stuff in this. The texture or consistency is a little flaky but again, there's only three ingredients in it so that's to be expected. I'm happy enough with this to make a permanent switch...I'll be buying this from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and genuinely flavorless
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an almost undetectable protein, this is it. It is not chalky, gummy, gritty or gross. It blends perfectly into my smoothies. Granted, I don’t just mix it with water or milk and call it a day. I usually make a full smoothie with some fruit and other flavor components. Nevertheless, other flavorless powders I have used have had terrible taste and a bad mouth feel. This one is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Bean

customer_reviews.title: Healthier plant based protein
customer_reviews.text: Whey protein just bloats me and I just cannot consume a lot of it. I wanted a plant based alternative and this brand has been my go to. I’ve tried other brands and they just had a gritty taste to it that this brand doesn’t have. I get unflavored so the taste isn’t great on its own but I’m used to it by now and most of the time I just add it to my shake with fruit and other things. Keep in mind that pea protein thickens up quickly so you need more fluid than you would use with whey.
customer_reviews.author: Siasina

customer_reviews.title: More arginine than shown here
customer_reviews.text: The taste is ok actually, but needs mixing in a smoothie or foods, digests pretty easily, my one complaint is that the pictures displayed here show the amino acid arginine as 700 something mgs, while on the container I received it says 2000 something mgs. Please update your photos to replicate true amounts. I personally wanted the lower amount of arginine as I wanted more lysine than arginine. So kind of upset about that. I’ll still see how it goes over time, but probably won’t purchase again. I don’t know if it’s intentional faulty advertising or some other situation.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Unique, filling, good profile
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the taste of this protein alone. The only thing I could find to mask it was a scoop of chocolate whey. The vanilla or strawberry didn't cover. However, it has a great amino acid profile to combine with whey and fills me up and I drink a little water to wash it down. Overall, I would reccomend with a warning, tastes and feels like wood pulp without chocolate... So add chocolate.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worst Pea Protein I've had
customer_reviews.text: This pea protein blend isn't sourced within the US or Canada, maybe it is processed here but it isn't originally grown here and you can taste it. The problem with this is the regulations and testing for metals are different. Its terribly low quality, I was amazed when I first tasted it of its extremely strong taste and graininess. Please don't buy this, I usually buy anthonys pea protein which is 2 lbs for $15 and it is grown within the us and processed here. Or check out just pea, which is another good option. Pea protein should be extremely smooth and have almost no taste at all.
customer_reviews.author: claire

customer_reviews.title: Toxic product! Bad batch!
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Naked protein powders for years and have never been disappointed. Now I am. This current canister is awful! I don't know what is wrong with it but it has a very off smell and taste. I've tried to drink it anyway but it literally makes me gag! No returns or replacement so I'm reviewing it as is. Toxic! Something is wrong! Im afraid to continue my subscription. Since they aren't accountable for sending out bad product!
customer_reviews.author: S Romans

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time and $$$
customer_reviews.text: I can’t drink whey protein because it gives me headaches so I thought I’d give this a try. I mix it with their powdered PB but it’s not enough to mask the earthy flavor. I’ve tried adding milk and sweeteners with very little luck. Since I can’t use it in my protein shakes, I might try using this in my baking to “save” it.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: What I expected
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the negative reviews on the vanilla flavor in this product. It’s a clean pea protein. Very little sugar. What do you expect? I’d guess most are coming from a higher sugar or whey based product. This works great. I add almond milk, a little vanilla, some cacao, a big handful of spinach and some frozen strawberries. Sometimes I make it thick and eat it like a smoothie bowl and sometimes I drink it. I’ll buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Momma5757

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This protein has little to no flavor, which may take some getting used to. However now when I drink other flavored vegan proteins now they taste too fake and sweet - I prefer the plainness of this one. It's also great to add to smoothies etc. Also if you're like me, I like that there is one single ingredient in this protein and I don't have to google what it is to understand it. Awesome product overall and I'll be buying this for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had espected
customer_reviews.text: Im giving only 2 stars ,when I could have giving it 5 ,because the only reason I bougth this product its because on the item before I bought it shows lesss largine and on the one I got has more largine than lysine ,largine gives me break outs ,so beware of this people if you need more lysine as the product supposed to have on their description but you end up having more largine than lysine check pics as proof ok,otherwise its fine
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this from grass fed whey protein to see if I noticed a difference in bloating/digestion. I can’t tell you if it helps build muscle any better or worse than whey because I’m not a scientist but I can say it’s way easier on the stomach. Do keep in mind you’re getting 5 pounds of pea protein, not a jug that’s filled to the rim. You’re still getting every bit of protein powder that you paid for but I guess people are fooled because the container isn’t filled to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Container came half empty
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the container, it was half empty. What was strange is that it was sealed. It looks like a couple of people have had this issue too. Amazon was kind of enough to return my money, but makes me feel like there is a chance it will come like this again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Chalky garbage
customer_reviews.text: I hoped so badly that this would be good. However, it is the chalkiest protein powder I've ever tried. No amount of water or smoothie ingredients covered up the flavor. Calling this unflavored is a lie. Do yourself a favor and skip this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Most revolting protein powder ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the most revolting protein powder I’ve ever tasted. There is no vanilla flavor and it quite literally tastes like rotten vegetables. It doesn’t blend well either; very chalky and gritty. I will never buy this again or recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Still too naked
customer_reviews.text: I like that you get a lot of powder for the money, but from my experience Vanilla was just a suggestion rather than a flavor. It did not taste like Vanilla, but it didn't taste bad either, not sweet for the amount of added sugar. Also you get less servings for the same price. Might as well buy unflavored if looking for isolated proteins like this.
customer_reviews.author: mstrine

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, no heavy metals. Not delicious, but it's not supposed to be.
customer_reviews.text: This is high quality protein for a good price, and it is sourced from North America, so no shady Chinese heavy metals. There are complaints in the reviews here that it doesn't taste good, but this is unflavored protein powder. What do you expect? It's on you to either power through it or go through the effort of making it tasty through additions. The tastiest way I have fixed it up is blending it with milk, frozen blueberries, cocoa powder, and stevia. Makes for a pretty tasty blend. I have also done some cooking with it, mainly pancakes. I'd recommend it, but know what you are getting. This stuff is not ice cream, it's a building block for your body.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 24601

customer_reviews.title: chalky flavor, doesn't blend
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying different vegan protein powders, looking for those without sweetness or other fillers. I thought this would be a great option, and it was at first. After using this 1-2 times each day for a couple week, began to develop GI issues. Of course, this is my own personal experience, I'm not saying this will occur for others. Besides that, really, the taste & unblendabilty (is that a word?) just didn't work for me. There is a very strong chalky taste that made it difficult to choke down. I wouldn't purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: R.E.L.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Only one ingredient, high protein shake!!!! I like that it has almost no flavor. I use it as part of my fitness plant based journey. I ad it to yogurt, hot oatmeal, smoothies... Bends and mixes very well. And the best part is that the scoop is small, so you are getting A LOT of protein with out a lot adding so much powder to your food...
customer_reviews.author: YCALO

customer_reviews.title: Great protein! However
customer_reviews.text: Great protein! However, this does not taste like the sugary protein powders most people like. This really has no flavor at all and it’s like drinking flour water. This protein powder is meant to be mixed with fruits and other ingredients. Fortunately for me, I can drink it by itself because I dislike sweet, artificially sweetened supplements!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Del Vecchio

customer_reviews.title: Best plant based protein out there !!
customer_reviews.text: Buying this product, I was hesitate at first but damn I was wrong to doubt Naked !! God damn !! It tastes amazing!! By amazing, I mean it's very subtle and smooth taste that doesn't make you sick. I've been using whey my whole life and I hated aftertaste of it. Don't have this issue with pea protein. Plus , you can mix it with anything and because of the subtle taste of the product itself , you'll mostly taste what you add. I did peanut butter powder and strawberries and it was DELICIOUS 😋👌
customer_reviews.author: Volodymyr

customer_reviews.title: Mixes very well in my smoothy
customer_reviews.text: I added this powder in place of part of my whey protein powder to add a different protein profile in my morning smoothy. I can't tell the difference. I orderd 1 pound first and just ordered the 5lbs lot and got a much better price(it has a long shelf life...1-1/2 year+) Perfect way to get more plant based protein. I love the price for this pure 100% Pea protein.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: Shake n bake like Ricky Bobby!
customer_reviews.text: I love this protein powder! I got the unflavored one. I use it everything from breads, soups, smoothies, you name it! You can bake it or shake it! I will be setting up auto shipments once this first one runs out. I love that it's only 1 ingredient, pea protein! This really fits with my healthy eating lifestyle and I will be trying out more of their products as well. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Wynn Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Best pea protein I've found.
customer_reviews.text: I try to not eat as much animal protein and find pea protein a great substitute for days I'm just not getting enough protein. I love that it isn't loaded down with sugar or artificial sweeteners. It works great in smoothies and I've even used it in peanut sauce for stir fry and it gives an added protein and thickener. I'm pretty poor and shop around for best value. This really was the best one I've found by far.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protein powder
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we wanted - plain protein powder with nothing else added, no sweetener, no fake flavors, no added vitamins, etc. It doesn't have much taste and when you blend it with a banana it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: L W Stubenrauch

customer_reviews.title: Amazing protein powder
customer_reviews.text: As a vegan, this protein powder is amazing. I use this in unison with Naked Rice and Naked Pb. Many users mention flavor and texture being sub-par but what were they expecting? It’s a vegan, low calorie, no additive protein powder.... two scoops is 27g protein but I’ll use four scoops, strawberry’s and bananas plus oj and almond milk and it’s awesome. Coconut yogurt completely hides grainy texture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Newbie Vegan
customer_reviews.text: I am new the "plant-based vegan diet" scene, but I am very pleased with this Pea Protein. I love the Naked brand and this did not disappoint. My only complaint is that I wish they would fill up the entire container up to the brim but that appears to be a protein powder industry standard. So annoying...
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic/static powder. No joke, no exaggeration.
customer_reviews.text: You might say I am trying to damage the reputation of this product, but really I am only trying to find a good protein powder for myself that gets me what I need and has no harmful substances in it. This protein powder has some kind of metals in it because it is magnetic to the scoop and my hands as well as the lid. I wish I would've passed this stuff up. I will probably be going to the Athlean X RX2 X-LR8 just because I trust Jeff's stuff more. Not an advertisement, just what I am thinking. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Myers

customer_reviews.title: Well it’s protein
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy again. It’s very gritty and takes a lot of liquid for it to be drinkable. If added to a smoothie it’s not too bad but I can still feel the grittiness. The flavor is fairly plain but it does add a nuttiness to anything it’s added to. Over all it’s not terrible but definitely not my favorite
customer_reviews.author: J wong

customer_reviews.title: Mixes well and is not to overpowering
customer_reviews.text: This blends better than another brand I had bought before. This brand also doesn’t have too strong a taste and doesn’t smell horrid like another brand I bought that to me literally smelled like dog food. The sodium content is also lower which I like a lot and I have mixed it in lattes, smoothies, breads, cupcakes, and sauces without it being overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: Linz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need, nothing you don't.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this protein powder now for about year straight. I'm a lactose and soy free water so this protein bring sourced and made the way it is keeps my digestive system happy. You will enjoy the flavor and consisteny if you don't enjoy very sweet foods, I.e., you would rather eat fruit than cake for dessert. The consistency is a nice middle ground between thick and thin. With agave nectar and unsweetened almond milk, I can get a nice vanilla malt flavor from this protein. I recommend it to all my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Migliore

customer_reviews.title: Naked Container
customer_reviews.text: Naked Pea Protein is a good product. It is very high in protein per serving and doesn't have any other ingredients except yellow pea protein. The flavor is tolerable and becomes easier to stomach with regular use. I have used both the 5 pound container and the 1 pound container. Here is what's holding it back from being a great product: Each container I have purchased arrives at 75 percent capacity [see image 2]. I want to continue supporting this product, but I think I might have to find an alternative if this keeps happening since this product isn't cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Isabelle Schnadig

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I hate drinking all these mixes because they often taste really bad, are difficult to mix, or have high amounts of sugars/sodium (which I'm trying to avoid). I was surprised to see how well it mixes and tastes with some almond milk or fresh juice. Definitely ordering some more!
customer_reviews.author: SxLxUxGxZ

customer_reviews.title: Taste like death.
customer_reviews.text: Tastes like crap. I would mix it 50/50 with some whey to stand it. Tried the chocolate and it was double nasty. Also, you get less servings because of the flavoring. If it sits for a minute all the protein will go to the bottom like sediment. Finally, what is with the phosphorus content. I’ve never seen anything with so much. Is that it ok to eat that much phosphorus? I am an athlete so I take in roughly a gram per body pound. So that would put me at 150% of my day my phosphorus? Gave it my best. Whey isolate wins every time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: WHAT THE...?!
customer_reviews.text: Look at these pictures and read the label. 1. It says that 2 scoops equals 4.3 TBSP - it does NOT! I used 2 LEVEL scoops, then scooped out 4 TBSP with pictured. Look how much is left! ANNND.... 2. They tell you to use 2 "rounded" scoops. What the hell kind of accuracy is that? You're messing with my health here! I bet I can get more in my "rounded" scoop than you can! ANSWERS PLEASE! Wait, there is NO WHERE on this page to add pics? Uuuuuuug!
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett Douglas

customer_reviews.title: The product is what is advertised
customer_reviews.text: I use the pea protein powder in smoothies every day. I like this particular product because it is pure and simply only pea powder. This allows me the broadest set of options for my daily smoothies. I can make all kinds, all flavors, all mixes depending on who is actually wanting the smoothies and what I have in my home and fridge.
customer_reviews.author: William Jorth

customer_reviews.title: Easily digestible
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact this protein is easily digestible. I have tried so many other brands & protein bases but had a terrible time digesting them. This was an answer to my searching! It's a little gritty but not bloating my stomach makes it worthwhile! No flavor means I can mix with anything!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Smells AMAZING - tastes okay
customer_reviews.text: Smells ridiculously good Taste is just okay, but if you’ve dealt with pea protein before you know that the taste is a tough issue to get around. It certainly tastes better than plain and there’s enough vanilla to notice it. Great for smoothies and stuff like mug cakes Overall, for the quality of the ingredients, you’re getting a pretty good deal here regardless of the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pea Protein
customer_reviews.text: My doctor advised I replace the whey protein powder I was taking with pea protein as it is much healthier. When I was taking the whey powder it always made me very nauseous, but I absolutely love this pea protein! Although it is a bit chalky in consistency, it mixes really well in almond milk. I also like the fact that it tastes really good and isn't too sweet. I like knowing that I am getting pure pea protein. I will definitely keep purchasing this product. Thanks so much for offering it!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L.

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly what the label says.
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what it says it is it has no flavor it's a good protein to add to a smoothie. I'm very impressed that this product does and is everything it says. I am on a low-carb diet I have a smoothie every morning and the protein from this has helped so much. If you cannot have milk this is such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Not tastey but awesome macros and no bullshit
customer_reviews.text: Probably my favorite protein powder at the moment. I was advised to switch over to a plant based protein powder to be more aware of what exact ingredients i’m frequently putting into my body. I looked alllll over, searching for the perfect macros with good reviews and fell upon this one! It doesn’t taste the best and I wouldn’t recommend mixing it with anything (fruit smoothies, etc) because it’s simply .. not tastey. But! taste wasn’t one of my priorities. I’ve never been a fan of flavored (vanilla, chocolate, etc) proteins anyways. It’s legit 1 ingredient! Straightforward and doesn’t contain any “processed” bullshit. Will probably stick with this one for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Virtuous in simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Unglamorous pea protein, that respects simplicity. Nothing really in the way of what should not be there. I have it as a backup fuel source for low-carbing. I appreciate the simplicity and purity of this product. No extraneous flavors and colors. Plain in it's virtue. When I run out, I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: nerdicon

customer_reviews.title: Worst tasting protien I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst tasting protien I’ve ever had and I’ve had tons. Like it is terrible, so gross. However I’m not giving them 1 Star because they have legit the cleanest ingredients on the market. No BS, no xantham gum just straight clean ingredients. So if you mix your protien in smoothies you will be fine. If you drink it just with water like I did then you will not be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good try, but ultimately a taste catastophe
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because 1) they gave a smaller sample size to try it which most companies don't do and I appreciate, and 2) the company has other good products which I've used. However the flavor of this protein powder is repulsive. The texture is chalky and it doesn't dissolve fully even with my Vitamix on full speed. Even after blending with a ripe banana and a cart of blueberries plus a splash of lemonade, because I didn't know what else could make it better, it tasted like cardboard (quite literally like paper). Unfortunately I had to toss it. Thank you Naked for trying but try again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for a migraine sufferer
customer_reviews.text: I've been a migraine sufferer all of my life, and recently have been having them almost weekly (up from one to two a YEAR). The culprit, artificial sweeteners and colors that are in almost every protein shake. Since switching to Naked Pea protein I've been migraine free and it's like someone flipped the switch off. The taste is obviously not amazing, but it's not terrible either. I just drink 2 scoops with room temp water and drink it quickly. But more importantly, it does exactly what it advertises, without the horrible additives. Win win.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan L. Rice

customer_reviews.title: great protein powder
customer_reviews.text: Naked Pea seems to have twice the protein that many of its competitors have. The taste may take some people a little getting used to; its hard to describe the taste. The best i can do is say its a like a noticeable nothing, it doesnt over power any other flavors its just there with them. Not at all deal breaker. Mixes well in a blender. My only complaint is the powder packs down so the there is a huge amount of empty space in both the 5lb and 1 lb jars they come in so not the most environmentally friendly packaging.
customer_reviews.author: heavylox

product_meta.title: 5LB 100% Pea Protein Powder from North American Farms - Vegan Pea Protein Isolate - Plant Protein Powder, Easy to Digest - Speeds Muscle Recovery
feature_bullets: ONLY ONE INGREDIENT: 100% Yellow Pea Protein with zero additives. Naked Pea contains no artificial sweeteners, flavors, or colors and is GMO-Free, Soy Free and Gluten-Free.
VEGETARIAN AND VEGAN PROTEIN POWDER: Dairy Free and made solely from raw yellow peas grown on environmentally friendly farms in both the USA and Canada.
MAXIMUM NUTRITION: 27g of Protein, 2g of Sugar, 2g of Carbs, 120 Calories, and 5.7g of BCAAs (branched-chain amino acids) per serving.
PROTEIN SHAKES AND RECIPES: Create pure pea protein shakes, vegan smoothies and healthy green drinks. Provide your body with the daily protein it needs by adding to tea, sauces, and other recipes.
CLEAN MUSCLE GAINS: Now pea protein can help maintain a clean diet, but you can also use our vegan pea protein powder in pre and post workout shakes, smoothies and recipes for maximum recovery.
